H0.text: Molecules are produced by electric current in a wire, as demonstrated by Michael Faraday.

H1.text: Chemicals are produced by electric current in a wire, as demonstrated by Michael Faraday.

H2.text: A vibration is produced by electric current in a wire, as shown by Michael Faraday.

H3.text: A magnetic field is produced by electric current in a wire, as demonstrated by Michael Faraday.

A4.text: It was by his research on the magnetic field around a conductor carrying a direct current that Faraday established the concept of the electromagnetic field in physics.

A5.text: Faraday is also responsible for discovering the laws of electrolysis, and for popularising terminology such as anode, cathode, electrode, and ion, terms proposed in large part by William Whewell.

A6.text: Soon thereafter he published his findings, proving that an electric current produces a magnetic field as it flows through a wire.
